entries.source: Chat Edit: 'okay how about instead we start from scratch, make a really basic startup function that just runs the back end and the front end with the necessary flags, if node isnt found just give them the 'sudo pacman -S npm' command and thats it.'

Chat Edit: '[ember@arch workout-main]$ ./start.sh
╔═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╗
║                    AI Fitness Planner                         ║
║                   Simple Start Script                         ║
╚═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╝
Starting backend server...
Backend will be available at: http://localhost:3002
Starting frontend...
Frontend will be available at: http://localhost:5173
Press Ctrl+C to stop both server and frontend
npm error code ENOENT

> fitness-planner-server@1.0.0 start
> node server.js

npm error syscall open
npm error path /home/ember/Desktop/package.json
npm error errno -2
npm error enoent Could not read package.json: Error: ENOENT: no such file or directory, open '/home/ember/Desktop/package.json'
npm error enoent This is related to npm not being able to find a file.
npm error enoent
npm error A complete log of this run can be found in: /home/ember/.npm/_logs/2025-07-23T20_24_24_810Z-debug-0.log
[ember@arch workout-main]$ Server running on port 3002'
